div1.p: Reed agrees to send McPherson supplies.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Dorsey M. McPherson, September 6, 1879
div1.p:
Your documents only received
and thoughtfully pondered over- I sent the
following telegrams to M.D-

“Letter and blank book received to-day
from Camp Thomas- As this Command will
be within 20 miles of Apache for next
3 months, can I not draw supplies from
Dr Reed- There is tri-weekly tr Commun-
ication with Apache, at present-”

D.M. McPherson,
A. A. Surg. USA

“Company D. is now within 7 miles of Apache-
Captain McGowan informs me that he will
be at Black River till Dec. 1st- If author-
-ized, could easily furnish Dr McPherson
with all necessary supplies-”

The wire is down, at present, but will
probably be working again by Monday-
If I am authorized to furnish you, I
will send you out the blank requisitions
& you can put down what you require --
will, however, in that case, send you full
directions- Will see you before the end
of the month & talk over Reports & c re-
quired- Keep cool in the meanwhile-
Concerning Cap't. McGowan's letter, if any
one leaves Turkey Hill for his camp
before you start, send it- If not
take it yourself -- and don't bother your
head about its importance one
way or the other- It was only sent
by Indian as far as Turkey Hill, &
you can't be considered as a
special Courier to carry mail to
Cap't. McGowan: Sabe? Long life
and a merry one to you, most grave &
reverend pillula-
div1.closer:
Ever, your friend, Bolus- My photo-
Bolus.
